label: LCCN
standard: Structure of the LC Control Number
description: Library of Congress name authority (persons, families, corporate bodies, events, places, works and expressions) and subject authority identifier

label: EAN13
description: Standard describing a barcode symbology and numbering

label: arXiv
description: Article identifier scheme used by arXiv. arXiv is an e-print service in the fields of physics, mathematics, non-linear science, computer science, and quantitative biology.

label: BibCode
description: Bibliographic reference code for a journal, maintained by Harvard

label: AID
description: PubChem BioAssay contains small-molecule and RNAi screening data along with associated annotation information from contributing organizations. BioAssay contains a collection of bioactivity and toxicity data that has greatly supported research in fields such as medicinal chemistry, drug discovery, pharmaceutical genomics and informatics research. As a primary archive, the provenance of all records belongs to the submitter.

label: Not Applicable
description: No Identifier has been selected or indicated in relation to recommended use, or in other relationships in the Knowledge Base

label: PMID
description: A PMID (PubMed identifier or PubMed unique identifier) is a unique integer value, starting at 1, assigned to each PubMed record.

label: OMID
description: Every entity in OpenCitations Meta (https://opencitations.net/meta) is assigned persistent internal identifier called OpenCitations Meta Identifier (OMID). The OMID has structure [[entity_type_abbreviation]]/[[supplier_prefix]][[sequential_number]]. For example, the first journal article ever processed has OMID br/0601 (the full URI is https://w3id.org/oc/meta/br/0601), where br is the abbreviation of bibliographic resource, and 060 corresponds to the supplier prefix, helpful in recognising at a glance the index it belongs to (i.e., OpenCitations Meta). Finally, 1 indicates that this is the index's first bibliographic resource ever minted.

label: RAID
description: A unique and persistent identifier for research projects

label: IGSN
provider: MARUM Center for Marine Environmental Studies at University of Bremen
description: IGSN is a globally unique and persistent identifier for material samples and specimens. IGSNs are obtained from IGSN e.V. Agents.

label: ScopusAuthorID
description: Identifier for an author assigned in Scopus bibliographic database

label: GDS ID
description: This database stores curated gene expression DataSets, as well as original Series and Platform records in the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) repository. Enter search terms to locate experiments of interest. DataSet records contain additional resources including cluster tools and differential expression queries.

label: ORCID
description: ORCID (Open Researcher and Contributor ID) is an open, non-profit, community-based effort to create and maintain a registry of unique identifiers for individual researchers. ORCID records hold non-sensitive information such as name, email, organization name, and research activities.

label: PIC
description: The PIC is a unique identifier for your organisation that is used to track and manage participants in EU-funded programs, projects, and initiatives

label: ARK
description: Multi-purpose persistent identifier for information objects of any type. Archival Resource Keys (ARKs) serve as persistent identifiers, or stable, trusted references for information objects. Among other things, they aim to be web addresses (URLs) that don’t return 404 Page Not Found errors. The ARK Alliance is an open global community supporting the ARK infrastructure on behalf of research and scholarship. End users, especially researchers, rely on ARKs for long term access to the global scientific and cultural record. Since 2001 some 8.2 billion ARKs have been created by over 1000 organizations — libraries, data centers, archives, museums, publishers, government agencies, and vendors. They identify anything digital, physical, or abstract. ARKs are open, mainstream, non-paywalled, decentralized persistent identifiers that can be created by an organization as soon as it is registered with a NAAN (Name Assigning Authority Number). Once registered, an ARK organization can create unlimited numbers of ARKs and publicize them via the n2t.net global resolver or via their own local resolver.

label: PSSM-ID
description: CDD is a protein annotation resource that consists of a collection of well-annotated multiple sequence alignment models for ancient domains and full-length proteins.

label: TaxID
description: The Taxonomy Database is a curated classification and nomenclature for all of the organisms in the public sequence databases. This currently represents about 10% of the described species of life on the planet.

label: RIN
description: A commercial protocol sharing tool, which allows scientists to check in protocols the way that computer scientists check in code

label: URL
standard: RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax
authority: Bitzi,Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN),W3C DID Working Group,Decentralised,World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)
description: A uniform resource locator (URL), colloquially known as an address on the Web, is a reference to a resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it

label: SRA ID
description: Sequence Read Archive (SRA) data, available through multiple cloud providers and NCBI servers, is the largest publicly available repository of high throughput sequencing data. The archive accepts data from all branches of life as well as metagenomic and environmental surveys. SRA stores raw sequencing data and alignment information to enhance reproducibility and facilitate new discoveries through data analysis.

label: CID
description: PubChem Compound records are derived summaries that give users access to a rich set of related content. Compound records contain unique chemical structures extracted from contributed Substance records through a process called ‘standardization’. Each Compound record points to at least one Substance record.

label: Z39.88-2004
description: The National Information Standards Organization (NISO) has developed standards for OpenURL and its data container as American National Standards Institute (ANSI) standard ANSI/NISO Z39.88-2004

label: IdRef ID/SUDOC
standard: IdRef – Identifiers and References for the ESR
description:
Identifier for authority control in the French collaborative library catalog (see 
also P1025). Format: 8 digits followed by a digit or "X"

label: QID
description: Unique identifier (UID) used in Wikidata

label: RAI ID
description: Research Analysis Identifier (RAI) of experiments will become a new Persistent Identifier (PID) that can be used in addition to existing PIDs. This identifier combines the result with the dataset and algorithm employed by a researcher to process the dataset.

label: URN:NBN:CZ
provider: National Library of the Czech Republic
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: National Library of the Czech Republic
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: VAT number
provider: Relevant government agency in each country
description: Identifier of person or company, used for value added tax purposes

label: DOI
description: The Digital Object Identifier System is for identifying content objects in the digital environment.

label: DOI: Crossref
description: One of the official Digital Object Identifier Registration Agencies of the International DOI Foundation

label: DOI: DataCite
description: The global consortium DataCite was established in 2009 to overcome the challenges of data citation. The aim of the consortium is to establish easy access to data, to increase the acceptance of data publication and to support data archiving.

label: ePIC
description: The ePIC system is one of several MPAs based on the Handle System, and offers EU-based mirroring and resolution of handles.

label: Ringgold ID
description: Identifier for organisations in the publishing industry supply chain

label: URN:ISMN
description: identifier for printed music (not in book form) developed by ISO.

label: ResearcherID
description: ResearcherID is an identifying system for scientific authors. The system was introduced in January 2008 by Thomson Reuters Corporation.

label: Protein GI number
description: The Protein database is a collection of sequences from several sources, including translations from annotated coding regions in GenBank, RefSeq and TPA, as well as records from SwissProt, PIR, PRF, and PDB. Protein sequences are the fundamental determinants of biological structure and function.

label: GitHub
standard: RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax

label: GitLab
standard: RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax

label: URN:NBN:IT
provider: ICCU - Istituto Centrale per il Catalogo Unico della Biblioteche Italiane per le informazioni bibliografiche
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: ICCU - Istituto Centrale per il Catalogo Unico della Biblioteche Italiane per le informazioni bibliografiche
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: NLM Catalog ID
description: The NLM Catalog provides access to NLM bibliographic data for journals, books, audiovisuals, computer software, electronic resources and other materials. Links to the library's holdings in LocatorPlus, NLM's online public access catalog, are also provided.

label: QID / WDQID
description: Wikidata is a collaboratively edited knowledge base operated by the Wikimedia Foundation. It is intended to provide a common source of certain types of data which can be used by Wikimedia projects such as Wikipedia. Wikidata functions as a document-oriented database, centred on individual items. Items represent topics, for which basic information is stored that identifies each topic.

label: dbGaP ID
description: The database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) was developed to archive and distribute the data and results from studies that have investigated the interaction of genotype and phenotype in Humans.

label: URN:ISBN
description: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is for identifying printed books.

label: JuFo-id
provider: Federation of Finnish Learned Societies (TSV) in Finland
description: Identifier in the Julkaisufoorumi (Finnish Publication Forum)

label: eISSN
description: ISSN for an electronic publication

label: GRID
description: International coverage of the world's leading research organisations, indexing 92% of funding allocated globally.

label: EIDR
description: Identifier for a film or television work, edit or manifestation, in the Entertainment Identifier Registry

label: HomoloGene ID
description: HomoloGene, a tool of the United States National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), is a system for automated detection of homologs.

label: URN:NBN:AT
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: RoR
description: ROR (Research Organization Registry) is a global, community-led registry of open persistent identifiers for research organizations. ROR is jointly operated by California Digital Library, Crossref, and Datacite.

label: OpenCitations Corpus
description: The OpenCitations Corpus is open repository of scholarly citation data made available under a Creative Commons public domain dedication (CC0), which provides accurate bibliographic references harvested from the scholarly literature that others may freely build upon, enhance and reuse for any purpose, without restriction under copyright or database law.

label: InChI
provider: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC)
description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) is a non-proprietary identifier for chemical substances that can be used in printed and electronic data sources. It is derived solely from a structural representation of that substance, such that a single compound always yields the same identifier.

label: URN: ISNI
description:
16-digit identifier for people and organisations
ISNI is the ISO certified global standard number for identifying the millions of contributors to creative works and those active in their distribution, including researchers, inventors, writers, artists, visual creators, performers, producers, publishers, aggregators, and more. It is part of a family of international standard identifiers that includes identifiers of works, recordings, products and right holders in all repertoires, e.g. DOI, ISAN, ISBN, ISRC, ISSN, ISTC, and ISWC. The mission of the ISNI International Authority (ISNI-IA) is to assign to the public name(s) of a researcher, inventor, writer, artist, performer, publisher, etc. a persistent unique identifying number in order to resolve the problem of name ambiguity in search and discovery; and diffuse each assigned ISNI across all repertoires in the global supply chain so that every published work can be unambiguously attributed to its creator wherever that work is described.

label: URN:NBN:SK
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: Handle
description: Handle System identifier, which is a superset of the DOI

label: W3ID
description: Secure, permanent URLs for your Web application that will stand the test of time.

label: URN:LSID
description: Life Science Identifiers are a way to name and locate pieces of information on the web. Essentially, an LSID is a unique identifier for some data, and the LSID protocol specifies a standard way to locate the data (as well as a standard way of describing that data)

label: GND
authority: Committee for Library Standards,German National Library
description: Identifier for the German National Library

label: Virta-id
authority: Finnish Ministry of Education and Culture
description: The Virta-ID is associated with the VIRTA Higher Education Achievement Register (VIRTA-opintotietopalvelu) in Finland. This service was built as part of the Raketti project during 2012 and 2013 and officially launched in 2014. It serves as a national data repository for Finnish higher education institutions, aiming to improve student admissions and facilitate various administrative and academic processes.

label: VIAF
description: Identifier for the Virtual International Authority File database [format: up to 22 digits]

label: Magnet
authority: W3C DID Working Group,World Wide Web Consortium (W3C),Decentralised,Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN),Bitzi
description: Magnet is a URI scheme that defines the format of magnet links, a de facto standard for identifying files (URN) by their content, via cryptographic hash value rather than by their location.

label: URN:NBN
authority: Decentralised,World Wide Web Consortium (W3C),W3C DID Working Group,Bitzi,Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN)
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: URN:NBN:CH
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: URN:NBN:DE
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: Committee for Library Standards,German National Library
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: URN:NBN:FI
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: National Library of Finland,ISNI International Agency
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: URN:NBN:NL
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: URN:ISRC
provider: International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI)
authority: International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI)
description: international standard code for uniquely identifying sound recordings and music video recordings

label: IMDb company ID
description: D for a company or organization listed in the Internet Movie Database

label: URN:NBN:SE
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: BusinessID
provider: Relevant government agency in each country
description: In Finland, a code given to businesses and organizations

label: SID
description: PubChem Substance is the primary archive for community-provided information about chemical entities.

label: ISLRN
provider: International Standard Language Resource Number Agency
authority: International Standard Language Resource Number Agency
description: The International Standard Language Resource Number (ISLRN) is a new, unique and universal identification schema for Language Resources which provides Language Resources with unique names using a standardized nomenclature. It also ensures Language Resources are identified, and consequently recognized with proper references in activities within Human Language Technologies, as well as in documents and scientific papers.

label: SWHID
description: Persistent identifier of a software source code artifact as archived in the Software Heritage Archive

label: EU PIC
description: A Participant Identification Code (PIC) is a 9-digit number that serves as a unique identifier for legal entities participating in European funding programmes. A PIC number has no expiry date.

label: URN:NBN:NO
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: National Library of Norway,ISNI International Agency
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: re3data
description: Re3data is a global registry of research data repositories that covers research data repositories from different academic disciplines.

label: URN:ISTC
description: Unique identifier for text-based works

label: ICD
scheme: International Classification of Diseases ID (ICD-10, ICD-11)
description: The International Classification of Diseases is the international standard diagnostic classification for all general epidemiological and many health management purposes.

label: SBN/ ICCU
scheme: Internal National Library of Italy Scheme
provider: Italian Central Institute for Cataloguing and Documentation (ICCU)
authority: Italian Central Institute for Cataloguing and Documentation (ICCU)
description: identifier issued by National Library Service (SBN) of Italy

label: DCO-ID
description: Digital object registration includes DCO-ID generation based on the global Handle System infrastructure and metadata collection using VIVO.

label: URN:NBN:HU
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: OpenURL
standard: ANSI/NISO Z39.88-2004 The OpenURL Framework for Context-Sensitive Services
description: An OpenURL is similar to a web address, but instead of referring to a physical website, it refers to an article, book, patent, or other resource within a website

label: IMDb title ID
description: ID that characterize a movie on Internet Movie Database

label: URN:ISSN
description: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) is a unique eight-digit number used to identify a print or electronic periodical publication, rather than individual articles or books.

label: Protein Cluster ID
description: This collection of related protein sequences (clusters) consists of proteins derived from the annotations of whole genomes, organelles and plasmids. It currently limited to Archaea, Bacteria, Plants, Fungi, Protozoans, and Viruses

label: CONFIDENT
description: ConfIDent makes conferences and other formats of scientific events persistently accessible in high quality.

label: OCLC Control Number
description: OCLC assigns a unique number to each bibliographic record input into WorldCat.

label: WOS
description: Unique academic work identifier assigned in Web of Science bibliographic database (Web of Science Core Collection only and do not include WOS: prefix)

label: PopSet ID
description: The PopSet database is a collection of related DNA sequences derived from population, phylogenetic, mutation and ecosystem studies that have been submitted to GenBank.

label: Nucleotide GI number
description: The Nucleotide database is a collection of sequences from several sources, including GenBank, RefSeq, TPA and PDB. Genome, gene and transcript sequence data provide the foundation for biomedical research and discovery.

label: GEO ID
description: This database stores individual gene expression profiles from curated DataSets in the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) repository. Search for specific profiles of interest based on gene annotation or pre-computed profile characteristics.

label: MeSH ID
description: MeSH (Medical Subject Headings) is the NLM controlled vocabulary thesaurus used for indexing articles for PubMed.

label: COL
description: Identifier of a taxon or synonym in the Catalogue of Life

label: Gene ID
description: Gene integrates information from a wide range of species. A record may include nomenclature, Reference Sequences (RefSeqs), maps, pathways, variations, phenotypes, and links to genome-, phenotype-, and locus-specific resources worldwide.

label: CrossRef Funders
description: The Funder Registry is an open registry of persistent identifiers for grant-giving organizations around the world.

label: CrossRef Grant
description: The Crossref Grant Linking System (GLS) is a service for research funders to contribute to open science infrastructure. As members of Crossref, funders create unique links and open metadata about their support of all kinds, from financial grants to prizes to use of facilities.

label: DAI
description: A unique number to all academic authors in the Netherlands as a form of authority control

label: Wikipedia
standard: RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax
description: Wikipedia is a multilingual, web-based, free-content encyclopedia project based on an openly editable model. It is written collaboratively by largely anonymous Internet volunteers who write without pay.

label: UPC
description: Barcode symbology used for tracking trade items in stores

label: URN:OID
provider: International Organisation for Standardization (ISO) and ITU-T
description: OIDs provide a persistent identification of objects based on a hierarchical structure of Registration Authorities (RA), where each parent has an object identifier and allocates object identifiers to child nodes.

label: GeoNames ID
description: Identifier in the GeoNames geographical database.

label: GePRIS
description: Identifies authors by the first 2-4 letters of their surname plus numbers (e.g. XX 1234 or YY 67) generated by Elektra, the DFG's internal administrative grant-processing procedure. This disambiguation is for DFG's internal processes only.

label: Toolkit ID
description: The NCBI C++ Toolkit is a public-domain collection of portable libraries, consisting of a cross-platform application framework and a set of utilities and supporting classes to work with biological data.

label: HAL article ID
description: identifier for an article in the HAL (Hyper Articles en Ligne) open access repository

label: XRI
description: An Extensible Resource Identifier (abbreviated XRI) is a scheme and resolution protocol for abstract identifiers compatible with Uniform Resource Identifiers and Internationalized Resource Identifiers, developed by the XRI Technical Committee at OASIS

label: URN:NBN:HR
provider: National and University Library in Zagreb
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: National and University Library in Zagreb
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: SF-edu-ID
description: The Register of educational institutions is a chargeable product of Statistics Finland containing the addresses of all educational institutions in Finland. The Register is updated yearly in the spring. The Register contains data collected 2023.

label: dbVar ID
description: dbVar is NCBI's database of human genomic Structural Variation — large variants >50 bp including insertions, deletions, duplications, inversions, mobile elements, translocations, and complex variants

label: Probe ID
description: The NCBI Probe Database is a public registry of nucleic acid reagents designed for use in a wide variety of biomedical research applications, together with information on reagent distributors, probe effectiveness, and computed sequence similarities.

label: dPID
authority: W3C DID Working Group,Decentralised,Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN),World Wide Web Consortium (W3C),Bitzi
description: DIDs  (dPIDs) are a new type of identifier that enables verifiable, self-sovereign digital identity using blockchain and DLT. DIDs are an effort by the W3C Credentials Community Group and the wider Internet identity community to define identifiers that can be registered, updated, resolved, and revoked without any dependency on a central authority or intermediary.

label: InChiKey
provider: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC)
description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI, see MIR:00000383) is an identifier for chemical substances, and is derived solely from a structural representation of that substance. Since these can be quite unwieldly, particularly for web use, the InChIKey was developed. These are of a fixed length (25 character) and were created as a condensed, more web friendly, digital representation of the InChI.

label: PURL
standard: RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax
description: A PURL is a Persistent Uniform Resource Locator

label: Genome ID
description: This resource organizes information on genomes including sequences, maps, chromosomes, assemblies, and annotations.

label: PMCID
description: PubMed Central® (PMC) is a free full-text archive of biomedical and life sciences journal literature at the U.S. National Institutes of Health's National Library of Medicine (NIH/NLM)

label: rs number
description: dbSNP contains human single nucleotide variations, microsatellites, and small-scale insertions and deletions along with publication, population frequency, molecular consequence, and genomic and RefSeq mapping information for both common variations and clinical mutations.

label: IMDb name ID
description: ID that characterize a person on Internet Movie Database

label: URN:ISAN
description: International Standard Audiovisual Number (ISAN) is a unique identifier for audiovisual works and related versions, similar to ISBN for books

label: Korean national author ID
authority: National Library of Korea,ISNI International Agency
description: The Korean National Author ID system is an identifier used in South Korea to uniquely identify authors, particularly those involved in academic and scholarly publishing.

label: URN:NBN:SI
provider: National and University Library of Slovenia
standard: RFC 8458: ‘Using National Bibliography Numbers as Uniform Resource Name’
authority: National and University Library of Slovenia
description: National Bibliography Number (NBN) is a group of publication identifier systems used by national libraries in countries such as Germany, Italy, Finland, Norway, The Netherlands and Sweden

label: URN
authority: W3C DID Working Group,World Wide Web Consortium (W3C),Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN),Decentralised,Bitzi
description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that uses the urn scheme

label: Bitbucket
standard: RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax
description: Bitbucket is a Git-based source code repository hosting service owned by Atlassian.

label: URI
authority: Bitzi,W3C DID Working Group,World Wide Web Consortium (W3C),Decentralised,Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN)
description: String of characters used to identify a name of a resource on a network such as the internet

label: CURIE
authority: Decentralised,World Wide Web Consortium (W3C),Bitzi,W3C DID Working Group,Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN)
description: A data type whose purpose is specifically to allow for the definition of scoped names that map to URIs

label: NZBN
description: The NZBN (New Zealand Business Number) is a unique identifier assigned to businesses and other organisations in New Zealand.

label: MMDB-ID
description: The Conserved Domain Database (CDD) brings together several collections of multiple sequence alignments representing conserved domains, in addition to NCBI-curated domains that use 3D-structure information explicitly to define domain boundaries and provide insights into sequence/structure/function relationships.
